Try this one:

```[2025-06-25 14:31:57] argocd  (git)-[main]- $ kubectl logs <validator_pod_name> --since=1h | grep "domain migration dump"
Defaulted container "validator-app" out of: validator-app, validator-init (init)
{"@timestamp":"2025-06-25T13:01:31.034Z","@version":"1","message":"Wrote domain migration dump at path /domain-upgrade-dump/domain_migration_dump.json","logger_name":"o.l.s.v.m.DecentralizedSynchronizerMigrationTrigger:validator=validator_backend","thread_name":"canton-env-ec-53","level":"INFO","level_value":20000,"span-id":"e68717d44dc36850","trace-id":"798240a596692baf39ef38954c7a6214","span-name":"DecentralizedSynchronizerMigrationTrigger"}

domain_migration_dump.json  lost+found```

text:
Hey people, has anyone had to migrate resources from one namespace to another?  what I’m thinking to do is to take a backup of the pg, recreate it in the new namespace, deploy everything in the new namespace, and slowly scale it down from the previous one (therefore keeping the same participant ID)…

I wonder if it would work given the documentation for DR usually assumes that the application is not running

text:
The document seems to a copy of this message. The links here work.

<https://chainsafeio.slack.com/archives/C08AP9QR7K4/p1750683127210359>

elements.text:
Key things to know:

WHEN:  2025-06-25 13:00 UTC  ( check your local time:
Prior to the date of HDM:
Wait for the Slack announcement stating that the Global Synchronizer has paused
Make sure the Validator has caught up
If you operate your own application, pause your app automation / app backend
Wait for the Slack announcement stating that the Global Synchronizer migration has been completed
flag “migrating” to true if you are using helm charts or pass -M if you are using the docker compose deployment
Make sure to also adjust the migration id suffix in the DB name of the participant node
This means you are keeping the validator database but creating a fresh new database for the participant
If you operate your own application with a separate database and automation, reset any off-ledger contract stores, let them reingest from the ACS, and then bring up your application backend again
Follow the link if you need more details for each step:

attachments.fallback:
[June 23rd, 2025 5:52 AM] wayne.collier: Key things to know:

WHEN:  2025-06-25 13:00 UTC  ( check your local time: <https://dateful.com/convert/utc?d=2025-06-25&t=13> )

ACTIONS REQUIRED:
• Prior to the date of HDM:
    ◦ Backup the Validator identities
• On the date of HDM:
    ◦ Wait for the Slack announcement stating that the Global Synchronizer has paused
    ◦ <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_major_upgrades.html#validator-upgrades-catching-up|Make sure the Validator has caught up>
    ◦ If you operate your own application, pause your app automation / app backend
    ◦ Make sure the <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_major_upgrades.html#validator-upgrades-dumps|migration dump> has been automatically created
    ◦ *Stop* the Validator (v0.3.21)
    ◦ Take <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_backups.html#backups-of-postgres-instances|backups of the Validator databases> (validator db and participant db)
    ◦ Wait for the Slack announcement stating that the Global Synchronizer migration has been completed
    ◦ Update the Validator *version* (to v0.4.1), configuration (if needed), *migration id* and set the *flag “migrating” to true if you are using helm charts or pass -M if you are using the docker compose deployment*
        ▪︎ Make sure to also adjust the migration id suffix in the DB name of the participant node
        ▪︎ This means you are keeping the validator database but creating a fresh new database for the participant
    ◦ Verify that the Validator works
    ◦ Set “migrating” flag back to false
    ◦ If you operate your own application with a separate database and automation, reset any off-ledger contract stores, let them reingest from the ACS, and then bring up your application backend again
• Follow the link if you need more details for each step: <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_major_upgrades.html>
attachments.text:
Key things to know:

WHEN:  2025-06-25 13:00 UTC  ( check your local time: <https://dateful.com/convert/utc?d=2025-06-25&t=13> )

ACTIONS REQUIRED:
• Prior to the date of HDM:
    ◦ Backup the Validator identities
• On the date of HDM:
    ◦ Wait for the Slack announcement stating that the Global Synchronizer has paused
    ◦ <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_major_upgrades.html#validator-upgrades-catching-up|Make sure the Validator has caught up>
    ◦ If you operate your own application, pause your app automation / app backend
    ◦ Make sure the <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_major_upgrades.html#validator-upgrades-dumps|migration dump> has been automatically created
    ◦ *Stop* the Validator (v0.3.21)
    ◦ Take <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_backups.html#backups-of-postgres-instances|backups of the Validator databases> (validator db and participant db)
    ◦ Wait for the Slack announcement stating that the Global Synchronizer migration has been completed
    ◦ Update the Validator *version* (to v0.4.1), configuration (if needed), *migration id* and set the *flag “migrating” to true if you are using helm charts or pass -M if you are using the docker compose deployment*
        ▪︎ Make sure to also adjust the migration id suffix in the DB name of the participant node
        ▪︎ This means you are keeping the validator database but creating a fresh new database for the participant
    ◦ Verify that the Validator works
    ◦ Set “migrating” flag back to false
    ◦ If you operate your own application with a separate database and automation, reset any off-ledger contract stores, let them reingest from the ACS, and then bring up your application backend again
• Follow the link if you need more details for each step: <https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_major_upgrades.html>

text:
<@UEHLS0JUB> these are the steps i took:
• `./stop.sh`
• `./start.sh -s $SPONSOR_SV_URL -o $ONBOARDING_SECRET -p "xxx" -M -m $MIGRATION_ID -w -a`
• `docker ps` → see that all containers healthy except _splice-validator-validator-1_ still starting
• `docker exec -it $(docker ps -qf "name=postgres-splice") bash` - to enter container
• `psql -U cnadmin -d postgres` - run psql
• `\l` → i see that participant-3 database is there
• `DROP DATABASE "participant-3";` → i try to drop participant-3 database, but get an error stating that there are 67 other sessions using the database
• `exit` `exit` → to go back to main terminal
• `docker compose stop participant` → to stop participant container
• `docker exec -it $(docker ps -qf "name=postgres-splice") bash` - to enter container again
• `psql -U cnadmin -d postgres` - run psql
• `DROP DATABASE "participant-3";` → successfully dropped participant-3 database
• `./start.sh -s $SPONSOR_SV_URL -o $ONBOARDING_SECRET -p "xxx" -m $MIGRATION_ID -w -a`
